Templates.name: sap.ui.generic.app.ApplicationController.invokeActions
Templates.helpDescription: Invokes an action for every provided context where the properties are taken as input from. The changes are submitted directly to the back-end.

Templates.template:
navigate(
	"${sSemanticObject}", // string
	"${sActionName}", // string
	"${vNavigationParameters}", // object|string
	{
		selectionVariant: "${selectionVariant}", // string
		tableVariantId: "${tableVariantId}", // string
		customData: ${customData}, // object

	},

		valueTexts: ${valueTexts}, // object
		selectionVariant: ${selectionVariant} // object
	},
	"${sNavMode}" // string
)
Templates.name: sap.ui.generic.app.navigation.service.NavigationHandler.navigate
Templates.description: navigate(sSemanticObject, sActionName, vNavigationParameters?, oInnerAppData?, fnOnError?, oExternalAppData, sNavMode?)
Templates.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.83.0 Please use {@link sap.fe.navigation.NavigationHandler#navigate} instead.
Node: If the oExternalAppData parameter is not supplied, the external app data will be calculated based on the oInnerAppData data.
SmartFilterBar control Parameters:
{object} oError Error object (instance of {@link sap.ui.generic.app.navigation.service.NavError}) that describes which kind of error occurred
{string} oError.errorCode Code to identify the error
{string} oError.type Severity of the error (info/warning/error)
{array} oError.params An array of objects (typically strings) that describe additional value parameters required for generating the message

Triggers a cross-app navigation after saving the inner and the cross-app states. Since 1.52.0 the navigation mode based on sap-ushell-next-navmode is taken into account. If set to explace the inner app state will not be changed. Note: The sNavMode argument can be used to overwrite the SAP Fiori launchpad default navigation for opening a URL in-place or ex-place.

Templates.template:
processBeforeSmartLinkPopoverOpens(
	"${oTableEventParameters}", // object
	"${sSelectionVariant}", // string
	{
		selectionVariant: "${selectionVariant}", // string
		tableVariantId: "${tableVariantId}", // string
		customData: ${customData}, // object
		presentationVariant: ${presentationVariant}, // object
		valueTexts: ${valueTexts}, // object
		semanticDates: ${semanticDates} // object
	},
	{
		selectionVariant: ${selectionVariant}, // object
		presentationVariant: ${presentationVariant}, // object
		valueTexts: ${valueTexts} // object
	}
)
Templates.name: sap.ui.generic.app.navigation.service.NavigationHandler.processBeforeSmartLinkPopoverOpens
Templates.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.83.0 Please use {@link sap.fe.navigation.NavigationHandler#processBeforeSmartLinkPopoverOpens} instead.
Node: If the oExternalAppData parameter is not supplied, the external app data will be calculated based on the mInnerAppData data.

Processes navigation-related tasks related to beforePopoverOpens event handling for the SmartLink control and returns a Promise object. In particular, the following tasks are performed before the SmartLink popover can be opened:
  • If mInnerAppData is provided, this inner app state is saved for back navigation at a later time.
  • The table event parameters (semantic attributes) and the selection variant data are combined by calling the method {@link #.mixAttributesAndSelectionVariant mixAttributesAndSelectionVariant}.
  • The combined data is saved as the cross app state to be handed over to the target app, and the corresponding sap-xapp-state key is set in the URL.
  • All single selections ("including equal") of the combined selection data are passed to the SmartLink popover as semantic attributes.
  • The method oTableEventParameters.open() is called. Note that this does not really open the popover, but the SmartLink control proceeds with firing the event navigationTargetsObtained.

		customData: ${customData}, // object

	},
	"${bImmediateHashReplace}" // boolean
)
Templates.name: sap.ui.generic.app.navigation.service.NavigationHandler.storeInnerAppState
Templates.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.83.0 Please use {@link sap.fe.navigation.NavigationHandler#storeInnerAppStateAsync} instead.
Changes the URL according to the current app state and stores the app state for later retrieval.

Changes the URL according to the current app state and stores the app state for later retrieval.

Templates.name: sap.ui.generic.app.transaction.BaseController.triggerSubmitChanges
Templates.helpDescription: Triggers submitting the currently tracked changes to the back-end.

Templates.name: sap.ui.generic.app.transaction.DraftController.createNewDraftEntity
Templates.description: createNewDraftEntity(sEntitySet, sPath, vPredefinedValues?, bCanonicalRequest?, oParameters?) : Promise
Templates.helpDescription: Creates a new edit draft on the client and sends it to the back-end. Additionally, possible changes that have been collected on the client are sent to the back-end.

Templates.constructorDescription: Constructor for a new transaction controller instance.
Templates.name: sap.ui.generic.app.transaction.TransactionController
Templates.helpDescription: Assuming state-less communication, each single data modification request (or change set in an OData $batch request) is a "mini-transaction", which saves data to the database. The class allows you to submit changes, invoke actions, OData CRUD operations in general, and trigger client-side validations. It ensures concurrency control and correct ETag handling. The class gives access to runtime draft handling for applications. Additionally error handling capabilities are provided to notify client implementations of error situations. The event fatalError is thrown, if fatal errors occur during execution of OData requests.
